status_message: The United Nations is moving quickly to deploy staff to its newly established political mission in Libya and begin work, the head of the operation said today, stressing that the initial focus will be on helping the country restore public security, plan for elections and ensure transitional justice.
link_name: New UN political mission in Libya begins operations and deployment of staff

status_message: Ten years after a global conference in Durban, South Africa, sought to uproot all forms of racism, much progress has been made, yet intolerance has actually increased in many parts of the world, top United Nations officials warned today.
link_name: UN officials call for more action to stem the tide of continued racism and intolerance

status_message: The accident at Japan's Fukushima nuclear power plant earlier this year highlights the need to strengthen nuclear safety and security, top United Nations officials said today at a meeting convened to rally political support and advance concrete action.
link_name: Fukushima accident a wake-up call to boost nuclear safety, UN forum told

status_message: Nigeria's President Goodluck Jonathan today proposed to the General Assembly the creation of a conflict mediation commission within the office of the United Nations Secretary-General to develop strategies for the resolution of disputes across the world.
link_name: Nigerian leader proposes creation of UN conflict mediation commission

status_message: Palestine should become an observer State at the United Nations as an intermediate step towards becoming a full Member State, French President Nicolas Sarkozy said today, calling for the immediate resumption of Israeli-Palestinian negotiations with a strict timetable to produce a lasting settlement within the next year.
link_name: Palestine should become observer State at UN as an intermediate step, France says

status_message: World leaders, diplomats, journalists, international experts and UN officials are gathering at UN Headquarters for the 66th General Assembly to tackle the planet's most pressing issues. Here, in their own languages, some of those attending share their impressions. Watch the videos!
link_name: Backstage Buzz: Voices from the General Assembly

status_message: Three independent United Nations human rights experts have called on the United States Government to stop the execution scheduled for later today of Troy Davis, amid concerns that he did not receive a fair trial.
link_name: UN human rights experts call on US to halt todays execution of death row inmate

status_message: Peace between Israel and the Palestinians can only be attained through negotiations, United States President Barack Obama told the General Assembly today, urging both sides to make compromises to break the current deadlock and saying that "statements and resolutions" at the United Nations will not resolve the conflict.
link_name: Talks the only way to end Israeli-Palestinian conflict, Obama tells UN

status_message: Welcoming world leaders to the United Nations, the President of the General Assembly today opened the annual high-level debate with a pledge to build a global partnership to ensure peace, prosperity and dignity for all.
link_name: Assembly President opens annual UN debate with pledge to build partnership for peace

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon told world leaders gathered at United Nations Headquarters today for the General Assembly's annual high-level debate that they face critical choices on global issues to ensure the well-being of future generations.
link_name: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon told world leaders gathered at United Nations Headquarters today for t

status_message: It's your General Assembly! The world is watching. Are you?
Ahead of Friday's mini-summit on Somalia, find out more on that east African country's progress and challenges from the Secretary-General's Special Representative for Somalia, Augustine Mahiga.
link_name: Interview with Augustine Mahiga, the Secretary-Generals Special Representative for Somalia

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon and the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA) have voiced shock and sadness after learning of the deaths earlier today of Burhanuddin Rabbani, the former president who has been spearheading recent peace and reconciliation efforts within the country, and several colleagues in an apparent suicide attack.
link_name: Afghanistan: UN strongly condemns assassination of former president

status_message: While lauding the progress made over the past year in the global effort to save women's and children's lives, Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today noted that millions of them are still dying needless deaths and called for advancing the goal of saving 16 million lives by 2015.
link_name: Lauding progress to date, Ban calls for boosting efforts to save women and children

status_message: The United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) announced today that one of the all-time greats of women's tennis, Serena Williams, will become the agency's next international Goodwill Ambassador.
link_name: Tennis star Serena Williams to serve as UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador

status_message: Representatives of governments, civil society and the private sector joined United Nations agencies today to emphasize the importance of good nutrition, which is vital not only for human health but also for national economic and social development.
link_name: Benefits of good nutrition take centre stage at UN high-level event

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today praised the role of French-speaking States and their cooperation with the United Nations in helping to advance the cause of democracy and human rights in countries affected by the Arab Spring of revolution against autocratic rulers.
link_name: Working together, UN and French-speaking States can advance Arab Spring  Ban

status_message: Boosting women's political participation and decision-making around the world is fundamental for democracy and essential for achieving sustainable development, women leaders taking part in a high-level event at the United Nations declared today.
link_name: Boosting womens political participation vital for democracy, UN forum stresses

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today strongly condemned the "excessive use of force" by Yemeni Government security forces against unarmed protesters, resulting in scores of people killed and many more injured in the past few days.
link_name: Yemen: Ban condemns excessive force used against unarmed protesters

status_message: The United Nations today launched an all-out attack on non-communicable diseases (NCDs) such as cancer and diabetes with a summit meeting devoted to curbing the factors, like tobacco and alcohol use, behind the often preventable scourge that causes 63 per cent of all deaths.
link_name: UN summit discusses ways to curb death toll from non-communicable diseases

status_message: The President of the Palestinian Authority, Mahmoud Abbas, told Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today that he intends to submit an application this Friday for Palestine to become a United Nations Member State.
link_name: Palestinians will submit UN membership application to Secretary-General on Friday

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today kicked off a counter-terrorism forum with a call for strengthening the collective resolve to defeat a menace that affects all nations and to build a safer world for all.
link_name: Ban opens UN forum with call for enhanced global cooperation against terrorism

status_message: The United Nations and its partners are asking donors to fund a $357 million plan to help the Pakistani Government provide vital assistance to more than five million people affected by massive flooding in the country's south.
link_name: Pakistan: UN and partners seeking $357 million to assist with flood response

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today discussed issues such as the Middle East peace process and the global economic situation with several world leaders who have arrived in New York for this week's high-level meetings at the United Nations.
link_name: Middle East, global economy feature in talks between UN chief and world leaders

status_message: The top United Nations official in Haiti today appealed to the international community to ramp up its funding and development activities in the impoverished country, warning that political tensions and precarious socio-economic conditions are threatening its stability.
link_name: Haiti: UN calls on world to stand by aid pledges at critical juncture for stability

status_message: United Nations agencies are scaling up their assistance to flood-affected people in Pakistan, where more than five million people are urgent need of food, shelter, safe water and access to health services.
link_name: UN agencies scaling up assistance to flood-affected Pakistanis

status_message: A United Nations human rights expert today called for taxing unhealthy food, regulating harmful marketing practices and standing up to the food industry, urging world leaders not to miss the chance at a summit next week to end a state of affairs that kills nearly 3 million adults each year.
link_name: World leaders must take binding steps to curb unhealthy food industry  UN expert

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon called on the international community today not to replace ozone-depleting gases that are now being phased out with highly potent global warming substitutes.
link_name: Ban warns world not to replace ozone-depleting gases with greenhouse substitutes

status_message: High levels of crime and insecurity continue to pose a challenge to social and economic development in Latin America and the Caribbean, despite steady improvements in governance over the past two decades, the head of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) has warned.
link_name: Violent crime threatens development in Latin America and Caribbean  UN

status_message: The number of young children who die each day has plunged over the past two decades, new United Nations figures show, but the world is still lagging far behind in efforts to achieve its target for reducing child mortality.
link_name: Substantial drop in child mortality around the globe, UN figures reveal

status_message: The world is undergoing "a moment of uncommon turbulence," facing enormous political, economic, humanitarian and environmental challenges, but the United Nations stands ready to help deal with all of them, Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said today.
link_name: UN stands ready for turbulent times ahead  Ban

status_message: This year's dramatic popular support for political change in North Africa and the Middle East showed that democracy is a governance model that people of all cultures yearn for, Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said today, noting, however, that it cannot be imposed from abroad.
link_name: Events in North Africa and Middle East prove democracy a universal yearning  Ban

status_message: The United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) said today it is working with African leaders to help the continent adapt agricultural approaches that are more resilient to the impact of the climate change and scarcity of natural resources.
link_name: UN working on ways to mitigate climate changes impact on African agriculture

status_message: The General Assembly today opened its annual session with a fervent plea for cooperation in tackling looming crises from conflicts to climate change, and a nostalgic look back to a former secretary-general who died 50 years ago in the service of peace.
link_name: General Assembly opens new session with plea for unity to tackle global crises

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon took the United Nations pulpit live to cyberspace for the first time today, answering questions submitted through Facebook, LiveStream, Twitter and other social media networks on issues ranging from UN reform and the Middle East conflict to poverty and food security.
link_name: UN chief takes to cyberspace for global conversation with public

status_message: A new United Nations report calls for an independent probe into alleged human rights abuses committed in Yemen since the start of protests earlier this year, as well as immediate action to protect civilians and address the "deteriorating" humanitarian situation in the country.
link_name: Yemen: UN report urges probe into alleged human rights abuses

status_message: The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) today launched a programme honouring Rabindrânâth Tagore, Pablo Neruda and Aimé Césaire, three poets who, each in his own way, carried high the standard of humanist values.
link_name: UN honours three humanist poets  Tagore, Neruda and Césaire

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has sent the report of his panel of experts on accountability issues during the final stages of the civil war in Sri Lanka to the United Nations human rights chief and the President of the Human Rights Council.
link_name: Ban forwards report on Sri Lanka war crimes to top UN human rights body

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon will tomorrow hold his first live "global conversation" with members of the public through social media networks, answering questions on a range of pressing United Nations issues.
link_name: UN chief to hold live global conversation with public via social media

status_message: The United Nations human rights chief today called on authorities in countries in North Africa and the Middle East going through political transition to exercise restraint and to take steps to prevent acts of retribution or revenge.
link_name: Countries in political transition should exercise restraint, says UN rights chief

status_message: The United Nations labour agency has brought together more than 3,000 leaders and experts from over 100 countries to discuss how to ensure a culture of safety and health at work amid the uncertain global economic environment.
link_name: UN forum on healthier and safer workplaces kicks off in Istanbul

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has voiced his profound sadness after a ferry sank yesterday off the coast off Zanzibar, Tanzania, killing almost 200 people.
link_name: Ban expresses sadness after hundreds die in Tanzanian ferry disaster

status_message: United Nations humanitarian agencies have begun to assist communities in southern Pakistan that have been pummelled by monsoon rains which have claimed the lives of almost 200 people and destroyed or damaged nearly one million homes in an area still recovering from last year''s catastrophic floods.
link_name: UN agencies begin relief campaign as flood waters swamp southern Pakistan

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon is calling on the world community to reinforce preventive diplomacy which, through a system of early warnings and skilled interventions, can pre-empt conflicts before they erupt, saving both lives and national resources.
link_name: Citing successes, Ban urges more preventive diplomacy to defuse conflicts

status_message: The United Nations today marked the 10th anniversary of the 11 September 2001 terrorist attacks on the United States with a solemn commemoration in the General Assembly Hall, music, poetry and a vow to intensify the battle against terror wherever it is perpetrated in the world.
link_name: UN marks 10th anniversary of terrorist attacks against United States

status_message: The United Nations human rights office today called on authorities in Nigeria to address the renewed ethnic and religious violence in the country, including by curbing hate speech and encouraging reconciliation among various communities.
link_name: UN rights office calls on Nigeria to address renewed ethnic, religious violence

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today wrapped up a four-nation visit to the South Pacific with a call for countries to "connect the dots" between issues such as climate change, food insecurity and water scarcity and work towards ensuring sustainable development for all.
link_name: UN chief stresses need to connect the dots on sustainable development

status_message: With nearly 800 million people unable to read or write, the United Nations today marked International Literacy Day with a warning that illiteracy undermines efforts to eliminate a host of social ills such as poverty and sickness and threatens the very stability of nations.
link_name: Literacy vital for overcoming poverty and disease and reinforcing stability  UN

status_message: – Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon and the leaders of Pacific island nations today called for urgent international action to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, stressing that climate change remains one of the greatest threats to the security, well-being and livelihoods of the peoples of the region
link_name: Ban and Pacific leaders urge ambitious reduction of greenhouse gas emissions

status_message: The new Libyan authorities have requested United Nations support for several post-conflict tasks, including elections, transitional justice and national reconciliation, according to a senior UN official who is in Tripoli to begin laying the groundwork for the world body's operations.
link_name: New authorities outline priorities for UN support to post-conflict Libya

status_message: United Nations agencies are mobilizing to assist at some 20,000 people who have fled the fighting in Sudan's Blue Nile state and arrived in neighbouring Ethiopia.
link_name: UN agencies dispatching aid as more Sudanese refugees flee to Ethiopia

status_message: Children are bearing the brunt of the Horn of Africa crisis and constitute the majority of all Somali refugees in neighbouring Ethiopia, the United Nations reported today.
link_name: More than 80 per cent of Somali refugees in Ethiopia are children  UN

status_message: The United Nations tribunal set up to prosecute the most serious offences committed during the Balkan conflicts of the 1990s today convicted Momčilo Perišić for crimes against humanity and war crimes and sentenced the former chief of staff of the Yugoslav Army to 27 years in prison.
link_name: Former Yugoslav army chief convicted by UN tribunal for war crimes

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today received the report of the independent panel of inquiry examining the May 2010 incident involving a flotilla headed for Gaza which found that Israel's interception of the vessels was "excessive and unreasonable," while the flotilla acted "recklessly" in attempting to breach the naval blockade.
link_name: UN chief receives report of panel of inquiry into Gaza flotilla incident

status_message: A senior United Nations official has arrived in Libya accompanied by an inter-agency humanitarian team to re-establish the UN presence in the capital, Tripoli, where the situation remains fragile, with essential services having been disrupted by the recent conflict.
link_name: Libya: UN official arrives in Tripoli to set up humanitarian operations

status_message: United Nations agencies and their partners are stepping up food distribution in refugee camps in Ethiopia that house people who have fled famine in neighbouring Somalia amid alarming malnutrition rates among children, the UN refugee agency reported today.
link_name: UN and partners boost food aid to Somali refugees amid alarming malnutrition

status_message: The United Nations human rights chief today welcomed the decision by Bolivia's top court to convict several high-level officials for their part in the deaths of over 60 people during anti-government protests in 2003, calling it an important step in the fight against impunity.
link_name: UN human rights chief lauds conviction of high-level Bolivians for serious crimes

status_message: Tennis ace Novak Djokovic, currently ranked number one in the world, will serve as a National Ambassador for the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) in his native Serbia, where he will promote children's rights and access to early childhood education.
link_name: Worlds top tennis player tapped by UN to promote child rights in native Serbia

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today pledged the continued assistance of the United Nations in helping Libya tackle its humanitarian challenges, as well as in building a democratic and stable nation once the current conflict is over.
link_name: At Paris conference, Ban pledges UN support for democratic and stable Libya

status_message: The United Nations refugee chief has called for a rapid increase in aid for Somalis uprooted by drought, famine and conflict, as he visited the capital, Mogadishu, which is hosting some 400,000 internally displaced persons (IDPs).
link_name: On visit to Mogadishu, UN refugee chief urges scale-up of aid for displaced Somalis

status_message: The head of the United Nations agency defending press freedom has voiced her alarm at continuing abuses committed against journalists in Syria and called on authorities to respect basic human rights, including the right to freedom of expression.
link_name: Syria: Senior UN official voices alarm at ongoing abuses against journalists

status_message: The International Criminal Court (ICC) today dismissed an appeal by the Kenyan Government to throw out the cases against six high-ranking national officials, including a deputy prime minister, two ministers and a police chief, for possible crimes against humanity in post-electoral violence more than three years ago.
link_name: International Criminal Court case against Kenyan officials to proceed

status_message: The United Nations voiced "extreme alarm" today at reports of "atrocious human rights violations" in Libya, including mass summary executions apparently carried out by Colonel Muammar al-Qadhafi's forces in the last few days before they lost Tripoli, the capital.
link_name: Libya: Atrocious abuses by Qadhafi forces cause for extreme alarm  UN

status_message: The United Nations today called on all States to end the "heinous crime" of enforced disappearances which has seen countless people vanish into secret prisons or worse, often never to be seen again, in cases of conflict and internal unrest.
link_name: All States must end heinous crime of enforced disappearances, UN demands

status_message: The United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) was today due to deliver an additional 90,000 bottles of water to the Libya capital, Tripoli, where the recent upheaval has cut the regular supply of potable water and put residents at risk of disease outbreaks.
link_name: Libya: UN to deliver additional consignment of bottled water to Tripoli

status_message: The head of the joint United Nations-African Union peacekeeping force in Darfur today voiced his appreciation to the Sudanese authorities for granting amnesty to five local sheikhs who were sheltering in the mission's premises for over a year fearing arrest for alleged crimes.
link_name: Darfur: Amnesty enables sheikhs sheltering at UN-African mission site to go home

status_message: The United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) today urged heightened preparedness and surveillance amid signs that a mutant strain of the deadly bird flu virus is spreading in Asia and beyond.
link_name: UN agency urges heightened surveillance after bird flu resurfaces

status_message: The United Nations and its diplomatic partners seeking a resolution to the Libyan crisis today urged the Security Council to release assets frozen under United Nations sanctions to the country's transitional authorities to help them set up a government in the North African nation.
link_name: Libya: UN official says medical aid and other humanitarian needs are key priority

status_message: African leaders convened a fund-raising conference today for famine-wracked Somalia, where tens of thousands of people have already died and 3.2 million are on the brink of starvation, with a top United Nations official warning that the crisis stretches far beyond hunger to issues of health, protection and livelihood.
link_name: World must fund famine-wracked Somalia to prevent generation dying, UN warns

status_message: The United Nations refugee agency today launched a campaign to highlight the plight of up to 12 million stateless people worldwide who are denied basic rights, including access to jobs, housing, education and health care by dint of their lack of citizenship.
link_name: UN agency launches campaign to highlight global statelessness problem

status_message: Police officer Shahzadi Gulfam tackles difficult policing challenges with determination and a smile. In the process, she has made the communities in her charge safer places to live.
link_name: Pakistani trailblazer wins award for UN female police peacekeepers

status_message: The economy of the occupied Palestinian territory (oPt) grew by 9.3 per cent last year, but that expansion was not enough to reduce the area's 30 per cent unemployment rate, the United Nations trade and development arm said in a new report released today.
link_name: High unemployment blights Palestinian lives, despite economic growth  UN

status_message: Senior United Nations officials are calling on countries, businesses and individuals to give generously to support efforts to tackle the food security crisis gripping the Horn of Africa, warning that the world cannot "afford to lose momentum" in the fight against famine, disease and starvation.
link_name: On eve of Horn of Africa pledging conference, UN calls for generous donations

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today stressed the need for maintaining national unity and fostering reconciliation in Libya when he spoke with the leader of the North African country's National Transitional Council, Mustafa Abdul-Jalil.
link_name: Libya: UN chief stresses unity and national reconciliation during transition

status_message: A United Nations-convened meeting on hunger in the Horn of Africa today called for a twin-pronged approach to tackle the food crisis, stressing immediate relief and the strengthening of the resilience of affected communities to enable them to cope with future shocks in the drought-prone region.
link_name: UN meeting in Rome discusses ways to tackle Horn of Africa food crisis

status_message: The Syrian Government's "widespread and systematic" attacks against its own people may amount to crimes against humanity and warrant an investigation by the International Criminal Court (ICC), the United Nations human rights office said in a report released today.
link_name: Syrian crackdown on protesters may amount to crimes against humanity – UN report

status_message: Omar Saleh was leading a peaceful and comfortable life as a trauma surgeon and university lecturer in Egypt when the call came from the United Nations health agency: surgeons urgently needed in war-torn Somalia. He didn't have to think twice.
link_name: Egyptian trauma surgeon on Somali front line epitomizes UN humanitarian role

status_message: UN peacekeeper Istvan Papp was abducted in Darfur and spent almost 90 days chained to a tree during his captivity. Read more about his ordeal here!
link_name: From the Field: Chained to a tree for three months  A peacekeepers ordeal in Darfur

status_message: The United Nations humanitarian chief today stressed the need to further scale up efforts to assist the millions of people suffering in Somalia and the wider Horn of Africa, warning that more lives will be lost to famine and disease without urgent action.
link_name: Aid efforts in the Horn of Africa need to be scaled up further, says UN relief chief

status_message: The United Nations is temporarily withdrawing some staff from Syria amid mounting international concern about the violent crackdown by Government forces against civilian demonstrators.
link_name: As concern rises about Syrian violence, UN relocates non-essential staff

status_message: The United Nations health agency and its partners have launched a guide to help fieldworkers provide vital psychological support to people affected by humanitarian emergencies.
link_name: New UN guidebook aims to improve psychological support for disaster victims

status_message: Death rates among Somali refugees who have entered Ethiopia to seek succour from famine has reached alarming levels, the United Nations refugee agency reported today, saying that while malnutrition was the greatest concern, a suspected outbreak of measles was responsible for many deaths.
link_name: UN warns of rising death rates among Somali children as disease takes a toll

status_message: People are continuing to flee Libya and Tunisia for a variety of reasons, the United Nations refugee agency reported today, noting that almost 2,000 people arrived on the Italian island of Lampedusa over the weekend from the two North African nations.
link_name: Thousands still arriving on Italys shores from Libya and Tunisia  UN agency

status_message: Nearly 330,000 have returned to South Sudan since the end of October last year from neighbouring Sudan, the United Nations humanitarian agency reported today, saying that most of the returnees were arriving by bus, train or river barge.
link_name: Hundreds of thousands return to South Sudan in past nine months  UN

status_message: The five countries bordering the Caspian Sea are to introduce an emergency response system to tackle oil pollution in the world's largest enclosed body of water as well as enhanced monitoring measures under new protocols to a United-Nations backed treaty.
link_name: Caspian Sea States take further steps against oil pollution under UN-backed treaty

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon strongly condemned the series of bomb attacks in several cities across Iraq today that reportedly killed dozens of people and wounded many others.
link_name: Ban condemns wave of deadly bombings across Iraq

status_message: The United Nations today called for a thorough investigation into violations of international law committed in Sudan's Southern Kordofan state in June which it said could, if substantiated, amount to crimes against humanity or war crimes.
link_name: UN urges inquiry into alleged war crimes in Sudans Southern Kordofan state

status_message: The United Nations relief chief visited the capital of Somalia today, stressing that aid workers must have safe passage to those in need so they can save the lives of millions of people at risk from malnutrition or infectious diseases as famine grips the Horn of Africa.
link_name: On 'heartbreaking' visit to Somalia, UN relief chief urges safe passage for aid workers

status_message: Are you up to speed on what's happening at the UN? Take a minute to test your knowledge!
The United Nations refugee agency said today it urgently needs 45,000 more tents as more Somalis continue to arrive in Kenya after fleeing drought, famine and conflict in their homeland.
link_name: Shelter needs grow as more Somali refugees stream into Kenya, says UN agency

status_message: The United Nations marked International Youth Day today under the slogan 'Change Our World,' with Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon underscoring the "stunning" role young people have played during the past year in overthrowing dictatorships.
link_name: On World Youth Day, UN celebrating young peoples role in ousting dictators

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today called on student leaders gathered at a United Nations forum in the Republic of Korea to make a difference and actively engage in tackling global challenges such as defeating poverty and creating a more sustainable world.
link_name: At global student forum, Ban urges future generation of leaders to make a difference

status_message: If you had 30 seconds to pitch an idea to the UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon, what would you say?
link_name: 2011 World Humanitarian Day Citizen Ambassador's Contest

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today discussed the need to mobilize international resources to counter famine in the Horn of Africa with Irish rock star Bono, a leader of the multi-partner Campaign ONE, which fights extreme poverty and preventable diseases in the world's poorest places.
link_name: Ban talks with rock star Bono on mobilizing aid for famine-wracked Horn of Africa

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon renewed his call on all sides in Libya to commit to a political process, lamenting the lack of progress in efforts to resolve the ongoing conflict.
link_name: UN chief urges all sides to commit to political solution to end Libyan crisis

status_message: In this montage, the UN's outgoing peacekeeper chief, Alain Le Roy, looks back on his three years managing some 16 UN peace operations around the world  through major crises and key achievements.
link_name: UN through the lens: Three years at the helm of UN peacekeeping

status_message: The United Nations World Health Organization (WHO) today launched a web-based tool that gives governments and health-care providers access to clear guidance on how to scale up life-saving nutrition interventions to combat all forms of malnutrition.
link_name: UN launches web-based guide to help combat all forms of malnutrition

status_message: The prices of grain and milk in the drought-hit Djibouti, Ethiopia, Kenya and Somalia have risen to record highs, exacerbating hardship for the estimated 12.4 million people in the region who are facing severe food shortages and famine in some parts of Somalia, the United Nations reported today.
link_name: High food prices exacerbate crisis in drought-affected Horn of Africa  UN

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today exhorted the world's academic community to find solutions to global hunger and malnutrition, come up with ideas to promote sustainable and inclusive development, and advance tolerance through mutual respect and understanding.
link_name: Ban exhorts academia to find solutions to global hunger, poverty and intolerance

status_message: The steps recently announced by President Barack Obama of the United States to strengthen his Government's capacity to help prevent genocide and other mass atrocities are "promising" initiatives, said Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon.
link_name: Ban welcomes measures announced by US to help prevent genocide

status_message: The United Nations is moving on two fronts to counter the worsening food crisis in the Horn of Africa, with an immediate infusion of food in an area where 640,000 children alone are threatened with acute malnutrition, and longer-term steps to spark an agricultural recovery.
link_name: UN moves on two fronts to combat life-threatening famine in Horn of Africa

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today urged the world to recognize the right of indigenous peoples to control their intellectual property, saying they needed help to protect, develop and receive fair compensation for their cultural heritage and traditional knowledge.
link_name: Ban urges greater appreciation of culture and creativity of indigenous peoples

status_message: Armed violence continues to affect large numbers of Iraqis, with minorities, women and children suffering disproportionately, torture widely reported and impunity rife, according to a United Nations report released today.
link_name: Human rights in Iraq remain fragile amid armed violence, torture and impunity  UN

status_message: The United Nations refugee agency today airlifted the first of three consignments of emergency relief supplies for famine-stricken people in Somalia's capital, Mogadishu, the first time the agency has delivered aid to the city by air in five years.
link_name: Somalia: UN agency airlifts emergency aid for famine-hit people in Mogadishu

status_message: United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon brought a message of international solidarity to parts of Eastern Japan still reeling from the effects of the 'triple disasters' triggered by the tsunami, earthquake and nuclear accident that struck earlier this year.
link_name: Japan: Secretary-General brings message of solidarity to 'triple disaster' areas

status_message: Are you up to speed on what's happening at the UN? Take a minute to test your knowledge!

The United Nations on Saturday voiced alarm at the plight of Somali refugees in the Dollo Ado camps in south-eastern Ethiopia following an outbreak of suspected measles, and called for urgent action to assist an already vulnerable population.
link_name: UN urges rapid response to measles outbreak in Somali refugee camps in Ethiopia

status_message: As the crackdown by the Syrian Government against its own people continues unabated, a group of United Nations human rights experts today renewed their call for an immediate end to the violence used by the authorities against ongoing protests.
link_name: UN human rights experts urge Syria to end use of violence against civilians

status_message: The outgoing head of United Nations peacekeeping today outlined the achievements of his department's numerous missions around the world, saying peacekeepers had protected civilians and brought stability to many countries where they were deployed.
link_name: Outgoing UN peacekeeping chief hails achievements of blue helmets

status_message: In an effort to promote reconciliation in Côte d'Ivoire, a senior United Nations official is meeting with former president Laurent Gbagbo and other detained members of his regime to ensure that their human rights are respected.
link_name: Côte dIvoire: UN official meets with detained ex-leaders to foster reconciliation

status_message: The environmental restoration of Nigeria's Ogoniland oil region could prove to be the world's most wide-ranging and long-term oil clean-up exercise ever, if contaminated drinking water, land, creeks and other ecosystems are to be brought back to full health, according to a United Nations report released today.
link_name: Cleaning up Nigerian oil pollution could take 30 years, cost billions of dollars  UN

status_message: The Security Council today condemned the widespread violation of human rights in Syria and the use of force against civilians by the country's security forces, calling for an end to the violence and urging all sides to act with restraint and refrain from reprisals, including attacks against State institutions.
link_name: Syria: Security Council condemns rights abuses and use of force against civilians

status_message: A senior United Nations official today voiced her concern after a Sudanese court jailed a journalist for covering the case of an alleged rape of an activist by security forces, stressing that it is the perpetrators that must face criminal charges, not those reporting on such crimes.
link_name: Rapists, not reporters, must face criminal charges in Sudan, says UN envoy

status_message: A senior United Nations official today appealed to all Somalis, both inside and outside the country, to work together to support the ongoing peace process and alleviate the plight of those suffering from famine, while pledging the world body's continued support in the coming days.
link_name: UN envoy calls on all Somalis to pull together to help those suffering

status_message: The new United Nations expert dealing with human rights in Iran today appealed to Tehran to fully cooperate with him in addressing issues of concern raised by the international community.
link_name: New UN expert appeals for Irans cooperation in addressing human rights concerns

status_message: Four United Nations peacekeepers serving in Sudan's troubled Abyei area were killed today and seven others were injured after a landmine detonated during a patrol, the UN reported.
link_name: Four UN blue helmets die after landmine detonates in Abyei area of Sudan

status_message: The United Nations human rights chief today voiced alarm at reports that at least 145 people have been killed in demonstrations in Syria during the past four days and called for an end to the bloodshed, warning the country's authorities that the world is bearing witness to the brutality against civilians.
link_name: Alarmed at Syrian bloodshed, UN rights chief demands authorities end brutalit

status_message: The head of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) has condemned the murder of an Afghan journalist and called for those responsible for his death to be brought to justice.
link_name: Afghan journalists killers must be brought to justice, says UN official

status_message: What is the responsibility to protect, also known as R2P, and how does it relate to events in Africa and Middle East? Check out this interview with the Special Advisor to the Secretary General, Edward Luck.
link_name: Interview with Edward Luck, Special Advisor to the Secretary-General

status_message: Restrictive planning measures applied by Israeli authorities in the zone of the West Bank known as Area C are forcing Palestinian residents out of the area, mainly because the zoning rules make it virtually impossible for them to obtain building permits, according to a United Nations report released today.
link_name: Israels restrictive zoning rules force Palestinians out of West Bank area  UN report

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today voiced his deep concern over reports from Syria that hundreds of protesters have been killed or injured in the city of Hama and other towns across the country during the weekend.
link_name: Syria: UN chief condemns latest bloody violence against civilians

status_message: The United Nations today appealed for a further $1.4 billion to save the lives of some 12 million people across the Horn of Africa stricken by a worsening drought, and to stop the crisis from becoming an "even bigger catastrophe."
link_name: UN calls for more funds to save lives across Horn of Africa

status_message: The United Nations human rights office today urged the Malawian Government to set up a transparent investigation into allegations that its security forces committed grave rights violations when they clashed with protesters last week.
link_name: UN calls on Malawi to set up inquiry into allegations of human rights abuses

status_message: The Security Council today extended the mandate of the United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq (UNAMI) for another year as it welcomed recent security improvements in the country but stressed the need for further progress on the humanitarian, human rights and political fronts.
link_name: Security Council extends UN mission in Iraq by another year

status_message: The United Nations has condemned an attack on its summer camp facility in Gaza and vowed that an attempt by thousands of Palestinian children to break a world record for kite flying will go on as planned today.
link_name: Camp attack will not deter world record attempt by Gazas children  UN

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has stressed the need for urgent funding to carry out critical humanitarian efforts in the Horn of Africa and assist the millions suffering from famine and drought in the region.
link_name: Ban stresses urgency of funding Horn of Africa relief efforts

status_message: Millions of Pakistanis affected by last year's devastating floods continue to need assistance to rebuild livelihoods, improve food production and generate income, according to the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), whose own efforts have helped some 900,000 farming households get back on their feet.
link_name: One year on, Pakistans flood survivors need continued support, UN agency stresses

status_message: The head of the United Nations nuclear agency today stressed that all States must comply with their obligations under the international nuclear weapons non-proliferation treaty, naming Iran, Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) and Syria as countries that are not in full compliance.
link_name: UN nuclear energy chief urges universal compliance with non-proliferation treaty

status_message: A United Nations human rights expert on freedom of religion said today that initial media reports on Friday's mass murder in Norway which implied a possible connection with Islamist terrorism were "revealing" and "embarrassing" examples of prejudice.
link_name: Erroneous linking of Norwegian attacks to Islam was revealing  UN rights expert

status_message: The United Nations refugee agency today condemned Sudan's deportation of Eritrean asylum-seekers on Monday, saying it was concerned with the increased frequency of such incidents and said they violated both international and Sudanese law.
link_name: UN refugee agency condemns Sudans deportation of Eritrean refugees

status_message: Up to 100,000 internally displaced people have arrived in the Somali capital, Mogadishu, over the last two months in search of food, water, shelter and other vital humanitarian assistance after fleeing famine-hit areas, the United Nations refugee agency reported today.
link_name: Number of famine-displaced Somalis seeking aid in Mogadishu swells to 100,000  UN

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today welcomed a meeting between Nobel Peace Prize winner Aung San Suu Kyi and a Myanmar Government minister, and urged the Government to consider release of political prisoners, according to a statement issued by a spokesperson.
link_name: Ban calls on Myanmar to consider early action on release of political prisoners

status_message: Emergency delivery of aid to people facing drought-related hunger in the Horn of Africa must be accompanied by longer-term efforts to boost food security in the region, Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said today, calling for an agricultural transformation that improves the livelihoods of rural communities in the region.
link_name: Aid to Horn of Africa must be linked to boosting long-term food security  Ban

status_message: The United Nations humanitarian chief today voiced concern at the dwindling stocks of aid for people caught up in the recent fighting engulfing Sudan's region of Southern Kordofan, warning the consequences will be grave unless aid workers are allowed in to replenish supplies
link_name: Sudan: UN relief chief sounds alarm over dwindling aid stocks in Southern Kordofan

status_message: Security Council members today strongly condemned the twin terrorist attacks in Norway that have killed more than 90 people, including many young people, and left numerous others injured.
link_name: Norway: Security Council deplores deadly terrorist attacks

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon voiced his shock after a deadly explosion struck the centre of the Norwegian capital, Oslo, earlier today, and a gunman shot dead participants at a nearby youth camp.
link_name: Secretary-General condemns deadly attacks in Norway

status_message: A United Nations investigation into mass rapes in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) seven months ago identifies the rapists as Congolese army soldiers, demands their prosecution and asks the Government to protect the victims from reprisals from the perpetrators.
link_name: UN report calls for prosecution of perpetrators of mass rape in DR Congo

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today made an impassioned plea to the international community to mobilize resources to avert a humanitarian catastrophe in Somalia, where severe drought has plunged communities in the southern region of the country into famine.
link_name: Somalia: Ban makes impassioned plea for help for famine-hit people

status_message: For many months United Nations aid agencies have warned of an impending crisis in the Horn of Africa as drought, failed harvests and fighting in some areas led to increasing food insecurity. Now conditions are so grim that the UN has turned to a word it uses sparingly and specifically – famine.
link_name: When a food security crisis becomes a famine

status_message: The United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) said today it will start airlifts within days to get vital supplies into Somalia, which is bearing the brunt of the humanitarian crisis in the Horn of Africa, and is preparing to open up a number of new land and air routes to bring urgent relief to millions in need.
link_name: Horn of Africa: UN steps up efforts to bring urgent relief to millions in need

status_message: The United Nations agency at the forefront of the global AIDS response has strongly welcomed new data that provides further evidence that male circumcision is effective in preventing HIV in men.
link_name: UN agency welcomes data showing male circumcision can help prevent HIV in men

status_message: Relief agencies require another $4.3 billion to assist millions of needy people around the world during the second half of this year, the United Nations humanitarian chief said today, adding that donors have so far made available 45 per cent of the funds requested at the start of 2011.
link_name: UN requests more than $4 billion in humanitarian aid for the rest of this year

status_message: Climate change is a real threat to international peace and security, Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said today, urging developed countries to lead the global effort to find ways to mitigate and adapt to it detrimental effects, with emerging economies shouldering their fair share of the responsibility.
link_name: Warning of climate changes threat to global security, Ban urges concerted action

status_message: Voicing deep concern at the escalating violence against peaceful protesters in Syria, Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon called on the country's authorities "to stop repression immediately" and urged all sides to refrain from violence.
link_name: Syria: Ban speaks out as violence continues to escalate

status_message: The United Nations today declared a famine in two regions of southern Somalia owing to the worst drought in decades, and appealed for urgent resources to assist millions of people in desperate need of help.
link_name: UN declares famine in two regions of southern Somalia

status_message: Public voting is under way in a United Nations contest aimed at finding the best advertising campaign to promote awareness in Europe about the battle to defeat gender-based violence, which affects more than two out of every three women worldwide.
link_name: UN contest for best campaign to end violence against women opens for voting

status_message: The United Nations refugee agency said today that with the increasing gravity of the situation in Somalia, where hundreds of thousands of people are suffering because of drought and conflict, it was stepping up assistance with aid distributions across the country's central and southern parts.
link_name: UN steps up aid to victims of drought in Somalia

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today appealed to donors to maintain their support for "Aid for Trade" efforts to help developing countries, especially the poorest, accelerate development and benefit from global economic growth.
link_name: Global aid for trade efforts vital for boosting development, Ban says at review meeting

status_message: The United Nations today marked the second annual Nelson Mandela International Day with a series of events dedicated to public service, as well as speeches, exhibitions and film screenings in recognition of the former South African president's contributions as a human rights defender, freedom fighter and peacemaker.
link_name: UN marks Nelson Mandela International Day with public service activities

status_message: The top United Nations envoy for Iraq has called on the country's authorities to develop a vision as well as strategies to improve the economic and social prospects for its young people, noting that a number of youth development indicators in a new report are of concern.
link_name: Iraq needs strategies to improve prospects for youth – UN envoy

status_message: The first in a series of emergency airlift flights arrived in the Kenyan capital on Sunday as part of the efforts of the United Nations refugee agency to assist the hundreds of thousands of Somalis who have taken refuge in neighbouring countries.
link_name: UN airlift arrives with vital aid for Somali refugees in Kenya

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today appealed to the international community to support the efforts of his special envoy tasked with helping to resolve the crisis in Libya to have both parties engage in direct talks.
link_name: Libya: Ban urges parties to engage in UN-mediated direct talks to resolve conflict

status_message: To mark the second annual Nelson Mandela International Day, the United Nations is encouraging people around the globe to perform 67 minutes of public service – one minute for every year of the South African leader's own service to humanity.
link_name: To honour Mandela, UN asks everyone to devote 67 minutes to public service

status_message: The head of the United Nations refugee agency today welcomed the decision by Kenya to open a new camp set up to ease congestion in the Dadaab refugee settlement where an influx of people fleeing drought and conflict in Somalia has swelled the refugee population to nearly 440,000.
link_name: UN welcomes opening of new camp for Somali refugees in Kenya

status_message: A United Nations humanitarian assessment mission to the Libyan port city of Misrata has found that high food prices, lack of money and shortages of medical supplies and other essential items have left residents in need of continued assistance.
link_name: Libya: UN mission to Misrata reports need for continued humanitarian assistance

status_message: The United Nations today opened its first human rights office in Tunisia, with the world body's top rights official lauding the country for inspiring the quest for political reform and human dignity across North Africa and the Middle East with its own popular uprising earlier this year.
link_name: First UN human rights office opens in Tunisia

status_message: The General Assembly today admitted the Republic of South Sudan as the 193rd member of the United Nations, welcoming the newly independent country to the community of nations.
link_name: UN Member States gather to welcome South Sudan to community of nations

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon and the United Nations Security Council condemned the terrorist attacks that struck various parts of the Indian city of Mumbai, stressing that such violence is unjustifiable.
link_name: Terrorist bomb attacks in India draw UN condemnation

status_message: The renewable energy sector has continued to perform well despite the global economic slowdown, cuts in incentives, and low natural-gas prices, according to a United Nations-backed report unveiled today, which shows that the sector supplied an estimated 16 per cent of global energy last year.
link_name: UN-backed report shows strong performance by renewable energy sector

status_message: The Security Council today recommended to the General Assembly that the Republic of South Sudan be admitted to membership in the United Nations, bringing the new nation one step closer to becoming the world body's 193rd member.
link_name: Security Council recommends South Sudan for UN membership

status_message: The United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) today called for greater protection for Iraqi children, hundreds of whom are still being killed and wounded in large numbers due to indiscriminate violence.
link_name: UNICEF urges protection and assistance for Iraqi children

status_message: The United Nations today welcomed the results of studies that show that taking a tablet of an antiretroviral drug daily can reduce the risk of acquiring HIV by up to 73 per cent in people not infected by the virus that causes AIDS.
link_name: UN hails studies showing antiretroviral drugs can prevent HIV infection

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today called on countries to urgently support United Nations agencies in their efforts to respond to the crisis in the Horn of Africa, where more than 11 million people are in need of life-saving assistance as they face the worst drought in decades.
link_name: Ban calls on countries to fund life-saving support for millions in Horn of Africa

status_message: The Security Council today, recognizing schools and hospitals as safe havens for children, called for all parties to conflict that attack such facilities to be held accountable and that they be added to the list published annually by the United Nations of those who commit grave violations against children.
link_name: Security Council calls for parties that attack schools and hospitals to be held accountable

status_message: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights today welcomed Senegal's decision not to repatriate former dictator Hissène Habré to Chad, but said that he should not be left to live with impunity in Senegal.
link_name: UN rights chief welcomes Senegals decision not to repatriate former dictator to Chad

status_message: The United Nations refugee agency said today it is scaling up its help to people fleeing recent fighting in north-western Pakistan.
link_name: UN scales up aid to thousands fleeing Pakistans latest conflict zone

status_message: The United Nations has strongly condemned the brutal killing of four de-miners in the western Afghan province of Farah, stating that attacks on those who deliver humanitarian services are totally unacceptable.
link_name: UN mission in Afghanistan deplores killing of de-miners

status_message: As the world population approaches seven billion, Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today stressed that ending global poverty and inequality is the key to unleashing the great human potential for prosperity and peaceful coexistence, while protecting the planet and safeguarding the natural resources that sustain humanity.
link_name: On World Population Day, Ban calls for greater efforts to end poverty and inequality

status_message: The United Nations envoy for Cyprus voiced sadness at the loss of life in the deadly explosion at a naval base in the south of the country earlier today, adding that the UN mission has offered to donate blood to help the injured and has cut electricity consumption after a power plant was damaged.
link_name: Top UN envoy offers world bodys assistance after deadly blast in Cyprus

status_message: Amid great jubilation, South Sudan today became the world''s newest State, formally seceding from Sudan to attain independence in the culmination of a United Nations-facilitated peace process that ended decades of conflict.
link_name: As South Sudan celebrates independence, UN vows support in quest for peace, prosperity

status_message: The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) will designate United States jazz musician Herbie Hancock as a Goodwill Ambassador later this month, the agency announced today.
link_name: Jazzman Herbie Hancock named UNESCO Goodwill Ambassador

status_message: The Security Council today voiced satisfaction with the progress countries in West Africa are making towards greater peace and stability, welcoming the positive developments in post-conflict recovery and peacebuilding, particularly in Guinea and Niger, as well as the end of the violent post-election crisis in Côte d'Ivoire.
link_name: Security Council praises progress towards peace and stability in West Africa

status_message: On the eve of South Sudan's independence, the Security Council today voted unanimously to set up a new United Nations mission to help Africa's newest nation consolidate peace and lay the foundation for longer-term state-building, conflict prevention and economic development.
link_name: On eve of independence, UN creates new mission to assist South Sudan

status_message: The United Nations is sparing no effort to assist the Central African Republic (CAR) in confronting serious challenges, including poverty, corruption and impunity, the Secretary-General's Special Representative in that country told the Security Council today
link_name: UN helping Central African Republic face serious challenges, envoy says

status_message: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, António Guterres, today began a four-day visit to Ethiopia and Kenya to check on the care provided to refugees fleeing Somalia.
link_name: UN refugee chief to review Somali refugee camps in Ethiopia and Kenya

status_message: Cereal prices dropped slightly in the world markets in June, but were still 71 per cent higher than a year ago, with the fall attributable to improved weather conditions in Europe and the lifting of Russia's export ban, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) reported today.
link_name: World cereal prices drop slightly but still steeply higher than last year  UN

status_message: Some of the world's poorest countries have made impressive gains in the fight against poverty, but the least developed countries still lag in efforts to improve living standards, the United Nations said today in a report showing significant overall progress towards achieving the global targets against extreme poverty.
link_name: UN reports progress towards poverty alleviation, urges increased support for the poorest

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today underlined the importance of promoting food security, saying that ensuring everyone has enough to eat has a positive spill-over effect on health, education and the empowerment of women, key catalysts for progress towards internationally agreed poverty eradication targets.
link_name: Food security key to achieving global anti-poverty goals  Secretary-General

status_message: Education is a fundamental human right that must be protected from economic difficulties and supported with adequate funding, an independent United Nations human rights expert said today.
link_name: Right to education must be supported with adequate resources  UN expert

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has voiced his disappointment over the continued fighting in Sudan's South Kordofan state and called on the parties to agree to a cessation of hostilities.
link_name: Ban renews call on Sudanese parties to cease hostilities in South Kordofan

status_message: In many countries, the rule of law still rules women out. But how are governments & civil society pioneering innovative responses to ensure that women can access justice and achieve their rights? Find the answers in UN Women 's new report "Progress of the World's Women: In Pursuit of Justice"!

Millions of women worldwide continue to experience injustice, violence and inequality in their homes, the workplace and public life, according to a new United Nations report that calls on governments to take urgent action to ensure real equality between the sexes.

The United Nations humanitarian agency reported today that the numbers of new arrivals of Horn of Africa drought victims at an already overcrowded refugee camp in north-eastern Kenya is growing "at alarming rates."
link_name: Regional drought causing alarming overcrowding at Kenyan refugee camp: UN

status_message: The United Nations independent expert on foreign debt and human rights warned today that the austerity measures and structural reforms proposed to solve Greece's debt crisis may result in violations of the basic human rights of the country's people, the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) reported.
link_name: Greek austerity measures could violate human rights, UN expert says

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today reiterated his concern over the growing number of attacks on schools and hospitals and threats to children in armed conflicts around the world, stating that the United Nations is considering targeted measures against those who commit such crimes.
link_name: Ban calls for stepped-up action against attackers of children in conflicts

status_message: The United Nations today urged African countries to empower the continent's youth through schooling and jobs, stressing that the foundation for peace and development lay in giving young people opportunities to build better lives for themselves.
link_name: Youth education and employment key to progress in Africa  Migiro

status_message: The United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) confirmed today that two Ethiopian staff members who went missing after a deadly incident in mid-May have been safely recovered.
link_name: UN agency welcomes safe return of two missing staff members in Ethiopia

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said today he is closely following the situation in Thailand ahead of this Sunday's national elections and hopes the polls will be credible and free from violence.
link_name: Upcoming Thai polls should be free, fair and peaceful  UN chief

status_message: A new United Nations report warns that Asian nations are at risk of electoral violence, driven by real and perceived fraud and corruption, and stresses the need for strong oversight and other measures to strengthen election credibility.
link_name: New UN report outlines measures to prevent electoral violence in Asia

status_message: An estimated 10 million people across the Horn of Africa are facing a severe food crisis following a prolonged drought in the region, with child malnutrition rates in some areas twice the emergency threshold amid high food prices that have left families desperate, the United Nations reported today.
link_name: Millions facing severe food crisis amid worsening drought in Horn of Africa  UN

status_message: The United Nations today declared that the world has completely eradicated a cattle disease that has killed millions of bovines for millennia. It is the first animal disease to be officially declared eradicated – and only the second disease ever, after smallpox.
link_name: UN declares deadly cattle plague eradicated after global campaign

status_message: The International Criminal Court (ICC) today issued arrest warrants for Libyan leader Muammar al-Qadhafi, one of his sons and the country's intelligence chief for crimes against humanity allegedly committed since the pro-democracy movement began in February.
link_name: ICC issues arrest warrants for Libyan officials for alleged crimes against humanity

status_message: The United Nations human rights chief today called on donors to support the fund that provides financial assistance to groups providing psychological, medical and social assistance to thousands of torture survivors and their families worldwide.
link_name: UN human rights chief appeals to donors to help support victims of torture
UN official condemns use of young child as unwitting suicide bomber

status_message: The joint trial of the four most senior surviving leaders of the notorious Khmer Rouge regime got under way today in Cambodia at the United Nations-backed tribunal set up to deal with the worst offences committed under the group's reign.
link_name: Cambodia: UN-backed tribunal begins trial against four top Khmer Rouge figures

status_message: The Security Council today established, for an initial six months, a United Nations peacekeeping force for the area around the Sudanese town of Abyei, which is contested by both north and south and has been the scene of renewed fighting in recent weeks.
link_name: Security Council sets up UN security force for disputed Sudanese town of Abyei

status_message: As the world's best soccer teams face off in Germany for the Women's World Cup, the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) is using the event to spotlight the need to empower women to play leading roles in daily life, from the home to the school to the workplace.
link_name: UN agency kicks off womens empowerment campaign at soccers World Cup

status_message: The International Criminal Court (ICC) today issued arrest warrants for Libyan leader Muammar al-Qadhafi, one of his sons and the country's intelligence chief for crimes against humanity allegedly committed since the pro-democracy movement began in February.
link_name: ICC issues arrest warrants for Libyan officials for alleged crimes against humanity

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today exhorted States to take effective legislative, administrative and judicial measures to prevent torture, calling the practice a brutal attempt to destroy a victim's sense of dignity and sense of human worth that can never be justified.
link_name: States must take effective measures to prevent torture – UN chief

status_message: A former Brazilian food security minister will become the first person from Latin America to head the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), the United Nations agency leading international efforts in the fight against hunger.
link_name: Brazilian to become next chief of UN Food and Agriculture Organization

status_message: The United Nations International Maritime Organization (IMO) is encouraging people today to voice their support for seafarers through social media as the world marks the first International Day of the Seafarer in honour of sailors' contribution to global commerce.
link_name: UN calls for messages of support to mark Day of the Seafarer

status_message: The lessons learned from the elimination of rinderpest, a deadly cattle plague that has threatened the livelihoods of herders and rural families for millennia, can be applied to tackling other major challenges, such as hunger and extreme poverty, a senior United Nations official said today.
link_name: UN lauds international cooperation in eradicating deadly cattle plague

status_message: Are you up to speed on what's happening at the UN? Take the quiz!

The historic section of the capital of Barbados today became the Caribbean country's first entry on the United Nations-managed World Heritage List after a committee of experts approved its inscription and that of two other sites.
link_name: Historic Caribbean capital leads latest inscriptions to UN World Heritage List

status_message: The first woman ever charged with genocide by an international court was today convicted of the crime and sentenced to life in prison by the United Nations war crimes tribunal set up in the wake of the mass killings in Rwanda in 1994.
link_name: UNs Rwanda genocide tribunal convicts woman of genocide for first time

status_message: Tunisia today became the first North African nation to join the International Criminal Court (ICC) and the 116th party to the treaty establishing the world's first permanent court tasked with trying people accused of genocide, crimes against humanity and war crimes.
link_name: Tunisia becomes first North African nation to join International Criminal Court

status_message: A United Nations envoy today welcomed the arrest of a former top Guatemalan military figure accused of genocide, war crimes and crimes against humanity, saying the arrest sends a strong signal that justice can prevail in the Central American country.
link_name: Guatemala: UN envoy against sexual violence hails arrest of former top military figure

status_message: A new United Nations report says that the international community can help create jobs and support the Haitian Government in ensuring basic services by investing directly in the country's people and institutions.
link_name: Give aid directly to Haitian institutions to build back better, says UN report

status_message: Check out the teaser for WFP Ambassadors Amadou & Mariam's new music video!

The United Nations human rights office today spoke out against the harsh sentences, including life imprisonment, handed down this week to several activists in Bahrain, saying their trials bear the marks of "political persecution."
link_name: Bahrain trials bear marks of political persecution, says UN human rights office

status_message: The United Nations political chief called today for the urgent resumption of Israeli-Palestinian peace talks, stressing the need for leaders on both sides to rise to the challenge of reaching an agreement that is in the interest of their respective peoples.
link_name: UN political chief calls for urgent resumption of Israeli-Palestinian peace talks

status_message: While global markets for cocaine, heroin and cannabis declined or remained stable, the production and abuse of prescription opioid drugs and new synthetic drugs rose, the United Nations annual drug report said today.
link_name: Global demand increasing for synthetic drugs, UN report finds

status_message: The prosecutor of the International Criminal Court (ICC) has requested authorization to open an investigation into war crimes and crimes against humanity allegedly committed in Côte d'Ivoire following the presidential run-off held last November.
link_name: ICC prosecutor seeks authorization to probe Côte dIvoire post-election violence

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today urged societies to ease the hardship that widows endure when their husbands die by respecting their rights to such social entitlements as access to inheritance, land tenure, employment and other means of livelihood.
link_name: UN chief urges societies to empower widows to play meaningful role in society

status_message: The United Nations Mission in Sudan (UNMIS) has strongly condemned the arrest yesterday by the Sudanese Government of six of its national staff as they were preparing to relocate from Southern Kordofan and urged that they be released immediately.
link_name: Sudan: UN mission urges immediate release of arrested staff members

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today welcomed the constitutional reform proposals which the Moroccan Government will put to the country's people at a referendum in July.
link_name: Secretary-General welcomes Moroccos constitutional reform plan

status_message: Ban Ki-moon has just been appointed to serve as United Nations Secretary-General for 5 more years. Find out what a day in his life looks like in this new video!
link_name: The World in a Day - The United Nations General Assembly

status_message: The head of the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) today congratulated the former presidents of Ghana and Brazil, John Kufuor and Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, who have been honoured for their vital contributions to improving the quality, quantity, or availability of food in the world.
link_name: UN official commends former leaders of Ghana, Brazil on winning World Food Prize

status_message: A new United Nations report finds that many governments did not pay enough attention to the social implications of the recent global financial crisis and urges that social investments be given priority in recovery programmes.
link_name: Social investments deserve priority in economic recovery schemes  UN report

status_message: The international singing sensation and Goodwill Ambassador for the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) Shakira today highlighted the power of education as she met with Jewish and Palestinian students who study together at a school in Jerusalem.
link_name: UNICEF advocate Shakira highlights power of education on visit to Jerusalem

status_message: The United Nations refugee agency has found the north-western Syrian town of Jisr al-Shugour and surrounding villages to be virtually empty of their inhabitants during a brief visit to the area where Government forces entered earlier this month and fought with protesters.
link_name: Syrian town almost deserted after recent fighting, UN agency finds

status_message: The United Nations General Assembly today agreed to appoint Ban Ki-moon to a second consecutive term as the Secretary-General of the 192-member Organization.
link_name: General Assembly appoints Ban Ki-moon to second term as UN Secretary-General
UN launches major push to improve global sanitation by 2015

status_message: The imminent independence of Southern Sudan is spotlighting the challenge of improving "among the world's worst" education systems, the UN said today.
link_name: UNESCO calls for urgent aid to education in Southern Sudan

status_message: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today welcomed the agreement in Sudan to demilitarize the disputed area of Abyei, over which the national Government and the Southern Sudan administration have engaged in fresh warfare.
link_name: Sudan: UN chief welcomes deal on temporary arrangements for disputed Abyei

status_message: Up to 3.6 million deaths could be avoided each year in 58 developing countries if midwifery services are upgraded, according to a report released today by the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) and partners.
link_name: Expanded midwifery services could save millions of lives  UN

status_message: UNHCR Goodwill Ambassador Angelina Jolie talking with asylum-seekers on the Italian island of Lampedusa yesterday. (Credit: UNHCR/J. Tanner)
Here's a photo of UNHCR Goodwill Ambassador Angelina Jolie and UNHCR chief António Guterres talking with asylum-seekers on the Italian island of Lampedusa. (Credit: UNHCR/J. Tanner)

An estimated 80 per cent of the world's refugees now live in developing countries and yet anti-refugee sentiment is growing in many industrialized nations, the United Nations said in a report unveiled today, urging the richer States to address the deep imbalance.
link_name: Poor countries host 80 per cent of worlds refugees, UN report shows

status_message: "The people in this camp have fled in fear for their lives, and many told me they were distraught about the safety of loved ones still in Syria," UN Goodwill Ambassador Angelina Jolie says during visit to refugee camp in Turkey.
link_name: UN Goodwill Ambassador Angelina Jolie meets with Syrian refugees in Turkey

status_message: The Security Council recommended that Ban Ki-moon be appointed to a second term as UN Secretary-General.
link_name: Security Council recommends re-appointment of UN Secretary-General

status_message: Higher food prices and volatility in commodity markets are here to stay, the UN Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) says in a report released today.
link_name: Agriculture commodity prices not likely to decline for some time, says UN report

status_message: African governments need to provide "more protective environments" to keep children safe and free from harm and exploitation, the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) urged today.
link_name: Africas children deserve more protective environments, UNICEF says

status_message: The United Nations-backed Summer Games for children have begun in the Gaza Strip in an annual attempt by its organizers to "give the kids of Gaza a chance to be kids."
link_name: Annual UN-backed Summer Games to give Gazas children a chance to be kids

status_message: The process of resolving the Libyan crisis should involve mutual concessions among the parties to the conflict and unconditional dialogue, the African Union said today, assuring the United Nations of its commitment to joint efforts to find an inclusive political solution.
link_name: Libya: African Union briefs Security Council on efforts to resolve crisis

status_message: The United Nations human rights office has called for a thorough probe into the allegations of widespread abuses committed by Syrian authorities during their violent crackdown against protesters, including the excessive use of force against civilians, arbitrary detentions and torture.
link_name: Citing widespread abuses, UN human rights office urges probe into Syria

status_message: A senior United Nations official today hailed the action plan signed by the Government of Chad to end the use of children by the country's security forces, while highlighting important next steps on the path to eradicating the scourge of child soldiers.
link_name: UN envoy hails Chads action plan to end use of child soldiers
